programme.title: Santo vs. el espectro del Estrangulador
programme.desc: Un maniático se dedica a asesinar a hermosas artistas como venganza contra la deformación que sufrió en el pasado.

programme.title: Detectives o ladrones
programme.desc: Dos detectives ayudan a un joven pobre a conquistar a la hija de un potentado quien es pretendida por un rico escocés.

programme.title: La miel se fue de la luna
programme.desc: Un doctor mujeriego va a casarse con Mini, una mujer extremadamente celosa. Mientras, engaña a ésta con su amante África y le dice que la esperará durante su gira por Cuba. Para África, no es el doctor Pablo sino un amigo suyo llamado Ricardo. Ambas mujeres se ven envueltas en un triángulo amoroso sin saberlo.

programme.title: Pepito as del volante
programme.desc: Un filme donde Joselito Rodriguez captura las fantasías de sus hijos.

programme.title: Muertos de risa
programme.desc: Un grupo de parientes interesados intenta hacer que una anciana muera del susto, mediante bombas, sorpresas y pasadizos secretos.

programme.title: Angelitos negros
programme.desc: Una mujer rubia se la pasa discriminando a la gente de color sin saber que por sus venas corre sangre de esa raza.

programme.title: Santo vs. el espectro del Estrangulador
programme.desc: Un maniático se dedica a asesinar a hermosas artistas como venganza contra la deformación que sufrió en el pasado.

programme.title: Detectives o ladrones
programme.desc: Dos detectives ayudan a un joven pobre a conquistar a la hija de un potentado quien es pretendida por un rico escocés.

programme.title: La miel se fue de la luna
programme.desc: Un doctor mujeriego va a casarse con Mini, una mujer extremadamente celosa. Mientras, engaña a ésta con su amante África y le dice que la esperará durante su gira por Cuba. Para África, no es el doctor Pablo sino un amigo suyo llamado Ricardo. Ambas mujeres se ven envueltas en un triángulo amoroso sin saberlo.

programme.title: Nosotros los guapos
programme.desc: El Vítor y Albertano, los galanes del barrio, tienen que pagar la renta de su apartamento, pero no encuentran trabajo y hacen muchas locuras con tal de tener un techo digno.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: La serie ligera y divertida de situaciones cómicas producida por la cadena mexicana Televisa, relata las vidas de los habitantes de un edificio de apartamentos y sus relaciones entre ellos, se exploran los conflictos y sucesos divertidos que pueden pasar entre vecinos al tener que vivir cercanamente con gente que tiene personalidades diferentes. Durante cada episodio de 60 minutos se tocan temas en la trama del programa como la envidia, la ambición, el egoísmo, la solidaridad y en general desarrolla temas que pasan a diario en la vida de un ser común. Su creador Eugenio Derbez, también participa como actor y comediante en la serie, junto a él también participan César Bono como Frankie Rivers, Eduardo España como Germán Martínez, Macaria como Magdalena Pérez y Polo Ortín como Don Roque Balboa, entre otros.

programme.title: La Familia Peluche
programme.desc: La serie de situaciones cómicas mexicana, se centra en una familia conformada por Ludovico, protagonizado por Eugenio Derbez, quien es la cabeza de la familia, su esposa, Federica (Consuelo Duval), y sus tres hijos, Junior (Luis Manuel Ávila), Bibi (Regina Blandón) y Ludoviquito (Miguel Pérez). Ellos viven en una ciudad muy particular, la cual está edificada con peluche y todos los accesorios son de peluche también. Ellos son una familia común y corriente que enfrentan problemas comunes, los cuales son representados en el programa de manera exagerada, los conflictos siempre terminan en situaciones divertidas. La comedia de humor original, ligera y única está dirigida para todo el público en general.

programme.title: 40 y 20
programme.desc: Paco es un cuarentón divorciado que se enloquece con las jovencitas y vive con su hijo Fran, un veinteañero con debilidad por las cuarentonas. La única que no parece estar de acuerdo es Rocío, la exesposa y madre.

programme.title: 5x8 comedia: Mundo loco
programme.desc: Destacados comediantes presentan hilarantes rutinas de 8 minutos en numerosos estilos.

programme.title: Humor es los comediantes
programme.desc: Se rinde homenaje a Raúl 'Chato' Padilla. Los Sketchistosos presentan: 'El que Sigue'.

programme.title: Humor es los comediantes
programme.desc: Raúl Astor es el celebrado. Los divertidos chistes de Carlos Bonavides y Carlos Eduardo Rico. Los Sketchistosos presentan 'El Menú del Día'.

programme.title: La hora pico
programme.desc: El programa de comedia mexicana "La Hora Pico" es un equivalente al programa estadounidense "Saturday Night Live" que entretiene al público con segmentos picantes y chistosos incluyendo a celebridades invitadas al escenario. Cada segmento incluye parodias entretenidas y divertidas que hacen reír a carcajadas. Dirigido por Miguel Barajas y producido por Carla Estrada y Reynaldo López.

programme.title: Cero en conducta
programme.desc: Jorgito es un estudiante rebelde e insolente que no tiene pelos en la lengua a la hora de burlarse de sus maestros. La Maestra Canuta y el Director Rigoberto Patiño son el blanco de todos sus chistes y no dudan en propinarle fuertes castigos cuando se dan cuenta de que la filosa lengua de Jorgito los está atacando. Este programa de comedia muestra a un grupo de irreverentes alumnos que por medio de sus chistes se burlan de la actualidad política y social mexicana. Nadie se salva de las burlas y de las ocurrencias de estos chiquillos que detrás de su apariencia inofensiva, esconden agudas críticas y chistes de doble sentido.

programme.title: Cero en conducta
programme.desc: Jorgito es un estudiante rebelde e insolente que no tiene pelos en la lengua a la hora de burlarse de sus maestros. Nadie se salva de las burlas y de las ocurrencias de estos chiquillos que detrás de su apariencia inofensiva, esconden agudas críticas y chistes de doble sentido.

programme.title: Una familia de diez
programme.desc: Plácido no encuentra empleo, por lo que prefiere quedarse cómodamente en su sofá, al igual que hace su padre. Plácido exige a los miembros de la familia que atiendan todos sus deseos para no levantarse del sofá, y ellos ya no lo soportan más.

programme.title: María de Todos los Ángeles
programme.desc: Albertano le manda a María la llave de su cuarto para que saque sus cosas, pero ella entiende le pide que se mude con él, con su llave tiene una pata de conejo de la buena suerte pero al ensuciarse, María la tira y le compra una pata nueva.

programme.title: María de Todos los Ángeles
programme.desc: Doña Lucha aprovecha el corte de agua en la colonia para vender unas cubetas que tenía apartadas. María se pone celosa de la nueva ayudante del equipo de futbol, Citlali, mientras que Albertano se la pasa en la banca por ser mal jugador.

programme.title: XH Derbez
programme.desc: El humor es el ingrediente principal de este programa que simula una televisora. Al inicio se presenta como un noticiero con varios segmentos que muestran situaciones cómicas, incluye parodias, bromas y se hacen burlas de las estrellas del mundo del espectáculo, al final de cada segmento se presentan los créditos de los comediantes que participaron. Es un espacio divertido y ligero donde la risa está presente constantemente. La serie incluye a algunos de los mejores comediantes conocidos por los hispanoamericanos.

programme.title: Una familia de diez
programme.desc: Una serie mexicana de situaciones cómicas que se centra alrededor de la familia López, que está integrada por un grupo colorido de personajes inusuales. El director y productor ejecutivo de la serie humorística es Jorge Ortiz de Pinedo que también protagoniza el papel de Plácido López en la serie, él es el padre y cabeza de esta familia interesante, que vive en un apartamento diminuto, junto a él actúa Zully Keith, quien hace el papel de la esposa abnegada llamada Renata Gonzáles, Eduardo Manzano actúa como Arnoldo López, el padre de Plácido, Mariana Botas interpreta a Martina López, la hija menor, Ricardo Margaleff hace el papel de Plutarco López, el hijo mayor de la pareja, María Fernanda interpreta a Alicia "Licha", la hermana de Renata, Andrea Torre es la Nena, la hija de Alicia, también están otros personajes como Adolfo, el novio de la Nena; Tecla, la indígena adolescente y Don Justo del Valle, el jefe de Plácido.

programme.title: Durmiendo con mi Jefe
programme.desc: Carlos logra reconciliarse con Gina y le propone matrimonio, noticia que no cae bien a su familia y jefe.

programme.title: Durmiendo con mi Jefe
programme.desc: Por azares del destino, Carlos encuentra al hijo de Gael y se entera de que es gay, pero Urrutia no lo sabe. Carlos tratará de esconder el secreto a toda costa.

programme.title: María de Todos los Ángeles
programme.desc: Una mujer romántica y trabajadora tiene como objetivo principal el encontrar el amor verdadero ya que no desea quedarse solterona, para ello le pide ayuda a los ángeles para encontrarlo.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: La serie ligera y divertida de situaciones cómicas producida por la cadena mexicana Televisa, relata las vidas de los habitantes de un edificio de apartamentos y sus relaciones entre ellos, se exploran los conflictos y sucesos divertidos que pueden pasar entre vecinos al tener que vivir cercanamente con gente que tiene personalidades diferentes. programme.title: 40 y 20
programme.desc: Paco acepta a ir a terapia con mucha gente extraña por su adicción a las mujeres jóvenes. Miranda descubre que Paco les paga a mujeres jóvenes para tener intimidad con ellas.

programme.title: 40 y 20
programme.desc: Paco organiza una fiesta e invita a todas las mujeres que le gustan, pero ninguna asiste y termina borracho con los amigos de Toña.

programme.title: Simón dice
programme.desc: Daniel está por cumplir su primer aniversario de bodas con Nicole. Simón le recuerda que un macho jamás debe recordar fechas importantes con su esposa, así como lo hacían los hombres de antes como Jorge Negrete.

programme.title: Simón dice
programme.desc: Bartolomé lleva varios días sin poderle cumplir a su esposa Carla. Simón le recomienda tomarse la pastilla azul, pero sin que su esposa lo sepa. Bartolomé intenta seguir el consejo de Simón aunque no recuerde muy bien cómo hacerlo.

programme.title: Humor es los comediantes
programme.desc: Mucha diversión con Moreno López y Edmundo Miller, hijo del Sr. Paco Miller a quien se rinde un merecido homenaje. Los Sketchistosos presentan 'Cosas de la Guerra'.

programme.title: Humor es los comediantes
programme.desc: Kikaro show, Teo González, Edson Zúiga y Poncho Aurelio. El homenaje es dedicado al gran maestro de la actuación Fernando Soler.

programme.title: Una familia de diez
programme.desc: Don Justo sale de la cárcel, y Plácido acude a su casa para pedirle trabajo, pero no esperaba lo que encuentra. Mientras tanto, Adolfo se declara anticapitalista y se niega a aceptar una oferta de empleo.

programme.title: María de Todos los Ángeles
programme.desc: Es el cumpleaños de Albertano y doña Lucha le organiza una fiesta, María se pinta el cabello y se pone su más lindo vestido para recuperar a Albertano, le dedica canciones compuestas por ella y le recita un poema. Doña Lucha se siente mal.

programme.title: María de Todos los Ángeles
programme.desc: Albertano le pide tiempo a María para pensar en el futuro de su relación y ella va con un brujo para pedirle ayuda. Doña Lucha intenta hablar con el chino sobre sexualidad.

programme.title: Una familia de diez
programme.desc: Una serie mexicana de situaciones cómicas que se centra alrededor de la familia López, que está integrada por un grupo colorido de personajes inusuales. El director y productor ejecutivo de la serie humorística es Jorge Ortiz de Pinedo que también protagoniza el papel de Plácido López en la serie, él es el padre y cabeza de esta familia interesante, que vive en un apartamento diminuto, junto a él actúa Zully Keith, quien hace el papel de la esposa abnegada llamada Renata Gonzáles, Eduardo Manzano actúa como Arnoldo López, el padre de Plácido, Mariana Botas interpreta a Martina López, la hija menor, Ricardo Margaleff hace el papel de Plutarco López, el hijo mayor de la pareja, María Fernanda interpreta a Alicia "Licha", la hermana de Renata, Andrea Torre es la Nena, la hija de Alicia, también están otros personajes como Adolfo, el novio de la Nena; Tecla, la indígena adolescente y Don Justo del Valle, el jefe de Plácido.

programme.title: Durmiendo con mi Jefe
programme.desc: Desesperado, Carlos le cede su departamento a Gael. Cuando se arrepiente, regresa y averigua que tiene dos nuevos inquilinos.

programme.title: Durmiendo con mi Jefe
programme.desc: Urrutia quiere ayudar a su yerno y vista un casino clandestino donde pierde todos los ahorros de la boda de Carlos.

programme.title: María de Todos los Ángeles
programme.desc: Una mujer romántica y trabajadora tiene como objetivo principal el encontrar el amor verdadero ya que no desea quedarse solterona, para ello le pide ayuda a los ángeles para encontrarlo.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: La serie ligera y divertida de situaciones cómicas producida por la cadena mexicana Televisa, relata las vidas de los habitantes de un edificio de apartamentos y sus relaciones entre ellos, se exploran los conflictos y sucesos divertidos que pueden pasar entre vecinos al tener que vivir cercanamente con gente que tiene personalidades diferentes. Durante cada episodio de 60 minutos se tocan temas en la trama del programa como la envidia, la ambición, el egoísmo, la solidaridad y en general desarrolla temas que pasan a diario en la vida de un ser común. Su creador Eugenio Derbez, también participa como actor y comediante en la serie, junto a él también participan César Bono como Frankie Rivers, Eduardo España como Germán Martínez, Macaria como Magdalena Pérez y Polo Ortín como Don Roque Balboa, entre otros.

programme.title: 40 y 20
programme.desc: Chio les cuenta a Paco, Fran y Toña que Víctor la dejó porque aceptó ser amiga de un hombre que conoció en una red social. Chio trata de convencer a Paco de pagar un increíble viaje para que ella pueda encontrar al hombre perfecto.

programme.title: 40 y 20
programme.desc: La tía de Fran se muda al mismo edificio que él para cuidarlo. Chayo obliga a Fran, Paco y Toña a seguir todas las reglas que quiere.

programme.title: La Familia Peluche
programme.desc: La serie de situaciones cómicas mexicana, se centra en una familia conformada por Ludovico, protagonizado por Eugenio Derbez, quien es la cabeza de la familia, su esposa, Federica (Consuelo Duval), y sus tres hijos, Junior (Luis Manuel Ávila), Bibi (Regina Blandón) y Ludoviquito (Miguel Pérez). Ellos viven en una ciudad muy particular, la cual está edificada con peluche y todos los accesorios son de peluche también. Ellos son una familia común y corriente que enfrentan problemas comunes, los cuales son representados en el programa de manera exagerada, los conflictos siempre terminan en situaciones divertidas. La comedia de humor original, ligera y única está dirigida para todo el público en general.

programme.title: Una familia de diez
programme.desc: Don Justo sale de la cárcel, y Plácido acude a su casa para pedirle trabajo, pero no esperaba lo que encuentra. Mientras tanto, Adolfo se declara anticapitalista y se niega a aceptar una oferta de empleo.

programme.title: Nosotros los guapos
programme.desc: El Vítor y Albertano, los galanes del barrio, tienen que pagar la renta de su apartamento, pero no encuentran trabajo y hacen muchas locuras con tal de tener un techo digno.

programme.title: + noche
programme.desc: Un late night show con invitados especiales y una variedad de secciones donde la comedia, la música y el entretenimiento se suman.

programme.title: 40 y 20
programme.desc: Fran lleva a una mujer mayor que él a su casa y esta se pone nerviosa al conocer a Toña y Paco. Toña cree que los horóscopos son reales y que por eso Fran conoció a Estrella.

programme.title: 40 y 20
programme.desc: Fran regresa de su viaje de generación con una noticia, se ha casado en La Habana con Yusnavis, una espectacular cubana, a quien ha traído a vivir a México.

programme.title: Humor es los comediantes
programme.desc: Jaime Rubiel, Jorge Falcón y Omar Alonso hacen tributo a la actriz Emma Roldán. Los Sketchistosos presentan 'El Cliente Siempre Tiene la Razón'.

programme.title: Humor es los comediantes
programme.desc: Los comediantes Danny Vega, Sergio Corona y Mara Escalante. Un homenaje al Sr. Roberto 'Panzón' Soto. Los Sketchistosos presentan 'El Roperazo'.

programme.title: La hora pico
programme.desc: El programa de comedia mexicana "La Hora Pico" es un equivalente al programa estadounidense "Saturday Night Live" que entretiene al público con segmentos picantes y chistosos incluyendo a celebridades invitadas al escenario. Cada segmento incluye parodias entretenidas y divertidas que hacen reír a carcajadas. Dirigido por Miguel Barajas y producido por Carla Estrada y Reynaldo López.

programme.title: Cero en conducta
programme.desc: Jorgito es un estudiante rebelde e insolente que no tiene pelos en la lengua a la hora de burlarse de sus maestros. La Maestra Canuta y el Director Rigoberto Patiño son el blanco de todos sus chistes y no dudan en propinarle fuertes castigos cuando se dan cuenta de que la filosa lengua de Jorgito los está atacando. Este programa de comedia muestra a un grupo de irreverentes alumnos que por medio de sus chistes se burlan de la actualidad política y social mexicana. Nadie se salva de las burlas y de las ocurrencias de estos chiquillos que detrás de su apariencia inofensiva, esconden agudas críticas y chistes de doble sentido.

programme.title: Una familia de diez
programme.desc: Plácido acaba de recordar que es su aniversario de bodas con Renata, por lo que le organizará una cena romántica. Martina invita al cine a la familia a ver el estreno de una película.

programme.title: María de Todos los Ángeles
programme.desc: A Doña Lucha se le ocurre hacer un calendario sexy con todas sus vecinas, pero no se vende como ella esperaba. María se pone colágeno en los labios para conquistar a Albertano.

programme.title: María de Todos los Ángeles
programme.desc: El Chino consigue trabajo probando videojuegos y provoca que Albertano busque el empleo de sus sueños. María decide buscar novio por internet y, durante una de sus citas a ciegas, el chico la cambia por Betzabé.

programme.title: XH Derbez
programme.desc: El humor es el ingrediente principal de este programa que simula una televisora. Al inicio se presenta como un noticiero con varios segmentos que muestran situaciones cómicas, incluye parodias, bromas y se hacen burlas de las estrellas del mundo del espectáculo, al final de cada segmento se presentan los créditos de los comediantes que participaron. Es un espacio divertido y ligero donde la risa está presente constantemente. La serie incluye a algunos de los mejores comediantes conocidos por los hispanoamericanos.

programme.desc: Un asaltante toma por sorpresa a Carlos cuando intenta aclarar las cosas con Marina.

programme.desc: Briones, Marina y Andrés son rehenes en una cafetería donde corren peligros sus vidas.

programme.desc: María busca darle celos a Albertano y busca un hombre guapo en un catálogo. Al verlos, Albertano se muere de celos y le confiesa al Chino que la quiere y le duele verla con alguien más.

programme.title: María de Todos los Ángeles
programme.desc: Albertano le confiesa a Lucha que está enamorado de María y quiere casarse con ella. María debe decidir si quedarse con Albertano o iniciar una vida al lado de un nuevo amor.

programme.title: 40 y 20
programme.desc: Fran lleva a una mujer mayor que él a su casa y esta se pone nerviosa al conocer a Toña y Paco. Toña cree que los horóscopos son reales y que por eso Fran conoció a Estrella.

programme.title: 40 y 20
programme.desc: Fran regresa de su viaje de generación con una noticia, se ha casado en La Habana con Yusnavis, una espectacular cubana, a quien ha traído a vivir a México.

programme.title: Una familia de diez
programme.desc: Una serie mexicana de situaciones cómicas que se centra alrededor de la familia López, que está integrada por un grupo colorido de personajes inusuales. El director y productor ejecutivo de la serie humorística es Jorge Ortiz de Pinedo que también protagoniza el papel de Plácido López en la serie, él es el padre y cabeza de esta familia interesante, que vive en un apartamento diminuto, junto a él actúa Zully Keith, quien hace el papel de la esposa abnegada llamada Renata Gonzáles, Eduardo Manzano actúa como Arnoldo López, el padre de Plácido, Mariana Botas interpreta a Martina López, la hija menor, Ricardo Margaleff hace el papel de Plutarco López, el hijo mayor de la pareja, María Fernanda interpreta a Alicia "Licha", la hermana de Renata, Andrea Torre es la Nena, la hija de Alicia, también están otros personajes como Adolfo, el novio de la Nena; Tecla, la indígena adolescente y Don Justo del Valle, el jefe de Plácido.

programme.title: Nosotros los guapos
programme.desc: El Vítor y Albertano, los galanes del barrio, tienen que pagar la renta de su apartamento, pero no encuentran trabajo y hacen muchas locuras con tal de tener un techo digno.

programme.title: Vecinos
programme.desc: La serie ligera y divertida de situaciones cómicas producida por la cadena mexicana Televisa, relata las vidas de los habitantes de un edificio de apartamentos y sus relaciones entre ellos, se exploran los conflictos y sucesos divertidos que pueden pasar entre vecinos al tener que vivir cercanamente con gente que tiene personalidades diferentes. Durante cada episodio de 60 minutos se tocan temas en la trama del programa como la envidia, la ambición, el egoísmo, la solidaridad y en general desarrolla temas que pasan a diario en la vida de un ser común. Su creador Eugenio Derbez, también participa como actor y comediante en la serie, junto a él también participan César Bono como Frankie Rivers, Eduardo España como Germán Martínez, Macaria como Magdalena Pérez y Polo Ortín como Don Roque Balboa, entre otros.

programme.title: 40 y 20
programme.desc: Fran lleva a una mujer mayor que él a su casa y esta se pone nerviosa al conocer a Toña y Paco. Toña cree que los horóscopos son reales y que por eso Fran conoció a Estrella.

programme.title: 40 y 20
programme.desc: Fran regresa de su viaje de generación con una noticia, se ha casado en La Habana con Yusnavis, una espectacular cubana, a quien ha traído a vivir a México.

programme.title: La Familia Peluche
programme.desc: La serie de situaciones cómicas mexicana, se centra en una familia conformada por Ludovico, protagonizado por Eugenio Derbez, quien es la cabeza de la familia, su esposa, Federica (Consuelo Duval), y sus tres hijos, Junior (Luis Manuel Ávila), Bibi (Regina Blandón) y Ludoviquito (Miguel Pérez). Ellos viven en una ciudad muy particular, la cual está edificada con peluche y todos los accesorios son de peluche también. Ellos son una familia común y corriente que enfrentan problemas comunes, los cuales son representados en el programa de manera exagerada, los conflictos siempre terminan en situaciones divertidas. La comedia de humor original, ligera y única está dirigida para todo el público en general.

programme.title: Una familia de diez
programme.desc: Aldolfo pierde el bono huachicolero por bañarse. La Nena busca una solución para ganar dinero y colaborar con la familia. Jacinta se convierte en la profesora de herboristería de Aldolfo. Carlos recibe regalos anónimos.

programme.title: Godfather of Harlem
programme.desc: Three Freedom Riders are murdered in Mississippi, and Bumpy Johnson wants justice, as well as a hedge against Federal investigation; Chin Gigante evades imprisonment with an "insanity" defense, and Malcolm X delivers his most fervent call to action.

programme.title: Fall River
programme.desc: The shocking story of a town caught in the frenzy of an alleged satanic cult practicing human sacrifice.

programme.title: War of the Worlds
programme.desc: Cracks start to show as the survivors find different ways to cope.

programme.title: War of the Worlds
programme.desc: The alien's connection to certain survivors raises difficult questions.

programme.title: Bound
programme.desc: Sparks fly when Violet (Jennifer Tilly) sets eyes on Corky (Gina Gershon) in an elevator. Violet is the girlfriend of a violent gangster, Caesar (Joe Pantoliano), while Corky is fresh out of prison and doing renovations on the apartment next door. As the two women launch into a passionate love affair, they assemble an intricate plan for Violet to escape from Caesar, with two million dollars of the mob's money -- but the important part is to make it out alive.

programme.title: Sliver
programme.desc: Well-to-do book editor Carly Norris (Sharon Stone) moves into a luxury apartment building before learning that a number of female tenants have been dying in grisly ways, allegedly at the hands of a serial killer. Soon, Norris becomes romantically involved with one of the prime suspects, building owner Zeke Hawkins (William Baldwin). The other suspect is her neighbor, writer Jack Landsford (Tom Berenger). Unsure of whom to trust, Norris must uncover the truth before she is the next victim.

programme.title: Midnight Heat
programme.desc: Banker John Gray (Brian Bosworth) is hit by a car, and he awakens days later having lost his memory. He goes through the motions of his plush Arizona lifestyle but keeps having momentary visions of a violent past and a sinister figure he identifies as Thomas Payne (Brad Dourif). After his wife, whom he barely knows, is killed, Gray travels to Los Angeles and explores the criminal underworld, hoping to discover the truth about his identity -- and to confront Payne.

programme.title: Sahara
programme.desc: Intent on winning a competition in place of her distinguished late father, beautiful young heiress Dale (Brooke Shields) takes on the guise of a man and competes in his spot, embarking on a car race that crosses the unforgiving Sahara desert. Although the villainous Rasoul (John Rhys-Davies) abducts Dale, the suave sheik Jaffar (Lambert Wilson) comes to her rescue. As Dale and Jaffar face more challenges and struggle to win the rally, they begin to fall for each other.

programme.title: Elvis Goes There
programme.desc: Elvis Mitchell meets filmmaker Paul Feig in London for a firsthand look at the evolution of his career in film, with the city's elegant style and traditions as a backdrop.

programme.title: The Last Man
programme.desc: A veteran who's suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder takes the advice of a street prophet and starts preparing for the end of days.

programme.title: The Little Hours
programme.desc: Medieval nuns Alessandra, Fernanda, and Ginevra lead a simple life in their convent. Their days are spent chafing at monastic routine, spying on one another, and berating the estate's day laborer. After a particularly vicious insult session drives the peasant away, Father Tommasso brings on newly hired hand Massetto, a virile young servant forced into hiding by his angry lord. Introduced to the sisters as a deaf-mute to discourage temptation, Massetto struggles to maintain his cover.

programme.title: The Haunting in Connecticut
programme.desc: When their son Matt (Kyle Gallner) receives a diagnosis of cancer, Sara (Virginia Madsen) and Peter (Martin Donovan) Campbell move to Connecticut to be closer to his doctors. At first all is well, but then Matt becomes increasingly disturbed by what appears to be paranormal activity. Sara turns to a priest for help, and the ghosts are seemingly banished -- but Matt's condition takes a sudden and unexplained turn for the worse, and the lives of Sara and the rest of her family are endangered.

programme.title: New in Town
programme.desc: Lucy Hill (Renée Zellweger), an ambitious executive, lives the high life in Miami. She loves climbing the corporate ladder as well as all the material goods that her success can buy. When she is offered a temporary assignment to restructure a factory in a backwater town, she eagerly accepts and anticipates a huge promotion in the pipeline. However, what Lucy gets is a life-changing experience and romance with the man of her dreams (Harry Connick Jr.).

programme.title: Florence Foster Jenkins
programme.desc: In the 1940s, New York socialite Florence Foster Jenkins (Meryl Streep) dreams of becoming a great opera singer. Unfortunately, her ambition far exceeds her talent. The voice Florence hears in her head is beautiful, but to everyone else it is quite lousy. Her husband St. Clair goes to extreme lengths to make sure his wife never finds out how awful she truly is. When Florence announces her plans for a concert at Carnegie Hall, St. Clair soon realizes that he's facing his greatest challenge yet.

programme.title: Four Weddings and a Funeral
programme.desc: Lovable Englishman Charles (Hugh Grant) and his group of friends seem to be unlucky in love. When Charles meets a beautiful American named Carrie (Andie MacDowell) at a wedding, he thinks his luck may have changed. But, after one magical night, Carrie returns to the States, ending what might have been. As Charles and Carrie's paths continue to cross -- over a handful of nuptials and one funeral -- he comes to believe they are meant to be together, even if their timing always seems to be off.

programme.title: Some Kind of Wonderful
programme.desc: Keith Nelson (Eric Stoltz), an artsy high school outcast, tries to land a date with popular girl Amanda Jones (Lea Thompson) with some help from his tomboy best friend, Watts (Mary Stuart Masterson). However, his advances draw the ire of Amanda's snobby ex-boyfriend, Hardy Jenns (Craig Sheffer), who makes plans to get even. Matters are further complicated when Watts realizes she likes Keith as more than just a friend and tries to convince him to stop pursuing Amanda.

programme.title: Waiting to Exhale
programme.desc: Navigating through careers, family and romance, four friends bond over the shortcomings in their love lives -- namely, the scarcity of good men. Both as the "other woman," Savannah (Whitney Houston) and Robin (Lela Rochon) carry on relationships with married men, each believing their lovers will leave their wives for them. On the flip side, Bernadine (Angela Bassett) ends up alone when her husband divorces her for his mistress. Meanwhile, Gloria (Loretta Devine) finds love with a new neighbor.

programme.title: One Fine Day
programme.desc: Melanie Parker (Michelle Pfeiffer) is an architect who needs to give a very important presentation. Jack Taylor (George Clooney) is a reporter looking to land a big scoop for his story. Both are single parents whose children, Sammy (Alex D. Linz) and Maggie (Mae Whitman), respectively, miss the bus for a field trip. Left with their kids on such a hectic day, Parker and Taylor decide to put aside their bickering and juggle baby-sitting duties, but the rambunctious children don't make it easy.

programme.title: What to Expect When You're Expecting
programme.desc: Challenges of impending parenthood turn the lives of five couples upside down. Two celebrities are unprepared for the surprise demands of pregnancy; hormones wreak havoc on a baby-crazy author, while her husband tries not to be outdone by his father, who's expecting twins with his young trophy wife; a photographer's husband isn't sure about his wife's adoption plans; a one-time hook-up results in a surprise pregnancy for rival food-truck owners.

programme.title: Fall River
programme.desc: The shocking story of a town caught in the frenzy of an alleged satanic cult practicing human sacrifice.

programme.title: Fall River
programme.desc: The shocking story of a town caught in the frenzy of an alleged satanic cult practicing human sacrifice.

programme.title: Godfather of Harlem
programme.desc: An incident at the Geechee Club threatens to break up Bumpy and Chin's partnership; Adam Clayton Powell looks to end the filibuster on the Civil Rights Bill, even if it means playing dirty.

programme.title: Godfather of Harlem
programme.desc: Three Freedom Riders are murdered in Mississippi, and Bumpy Johnson wants justice, as well as a hedge against Federal investigation; Chin Gigante evades imprisonment with an "insanity" defense, and Malcolm X delivers his most fervent call to action.

programme.title: Elvis Goes There
programme.desc: Elvis Mitchell teams up with director Guillermo del Toro ("The Shape of Water") in Los Angeles, where they meet with actor Laurence Fishburne, director Ana Lily Amirpour and the unsung heroes who bring film creatures to life.

programme.title: Cyrano, My Love
programme.desc: In 1897 in Paris, a playwright offers a new and unwritten production to an investor.

programme.title: The Bookshop
programme.desc: Florence Green, a free-spirited widow, puts grief behind her and risks everything to open up a bookshop -- the first such shop in the sleepy seaside town of Hardborough, England. But this mini social revolution soon brings her fierce enemies: she invites the hostility of the town's less prosperous shopkeepers and also crosses Mrs. Gamart, Harborough's vengeful, embittered alpha female who is a wannabe doyenne of the local arts scene.

programme.title: Waiting to Exhale
programme.desc: Navigating through careers, family and romance, four friends bond over the shortcomings in their love lives -- namely, the scarcity of good men. Both as the "other woman," Savannah (Whitney Houston) and Robin (Lela Rochon) carry on relationships with married men, each believing their lovers will leave their wives for them. On the flip side, Bernadine (Angela Bassett) ends up alone when her husband divorces her for his mistress. Meanwhile, Gloria (Loretta Devine) finds love with a new neighbor.

programme.title: The Virgin Suicides
programme.desc: In an ordinary suburban house, on a lovely tree-lined street, in the middle of 1970s America, lived the five beautiful, dreamy Lisbon sisters, whose doomed fates indelibly marked the neighborhood boys who to this day continue to obsess over them. A story of love and repression, fantasy and terror, sex and death, memory and longing. It is at its core a mystery story: a heart-rending investigation into the impenetrable, life-altering secrets of American adolescence.

programme.title: Girl With a Pearl Earring
programme.desc: When her father goes blind, Griet (Scarlett Johansson) must go to work as a maid for painter Johannes Vermeer (Colin Firth). While cleaning the house, Griet strikes up an unlikely friendship with Vermeer, which both agree to keep secret for fear of provoking the painter's jealous wife, Catharina (Essie Davis). When wealthy patron Van Ruijven (Tom Wilkinson) begins to lust after Griet, and commissions a painting of her, Vermeer and Griet are obliged to spend long hours alone together.

programme.title: Judy
programme.desc: Thirty years after starring in "The Wizard of Oz," beloved actress and singer Judy Garland arrives in London to perform sold-out shows at the Talk of the Town nightclub. While there, she reminisces with friends and fans and begins a whirlwind romance with musician Mickey Deans, her soon-to-be fifth husband.

programme.title: Fall River
programme.desc: The shocking story of a town caught in the frenzy of an alleged satanic cult practicing human sacrifice.

programme.title: Godfather of Harlem
programme.desc: Three Freedom Riders are murdered in Mississippi, and Bumpy Johnson wants justice, as well as a hedge against Federal investigation; Chin Gigante evades imprisonment with an "insanity" defense, and Malcolm X delivers his most fervent call to action.

programme.title: The Age of Adaline
programme.desc: Adaline Bowman (Blake Lively) has miraculously remained a youthful 29 years of age for nearly eight decades, never allowing herself to get close to anyone lest they discover her secret. However, a chance encounter with a charismatic philanthropist named Ellis Jones (Michiel Huisman) reawakens Adaline's long-suppressed passion for life and romance. When a weekend with Ellis' parents threatens to expose the truth, Adaline makes a decision that changes her life forever.

programme.title: Regarding Henry
programme.desc: An unscrupulous corporate lawyer, Henry Turner (Harrison Ford) will do whatever it takes to win a case, and treats his family with the same degree of ruthlessness. After Henry gets caught in the middle of a robbery and is shot in the head, he wakes from a coma to find that he has amnesia and can't even remember how to do the simplest of tasks. As he recovers and relearns how to function, Henry reveals a much kinder and more thoughtful personality, much to the surprise of his family and friends.

programme.title: Bombshell
programme.desc: The provocative real story of three whip-smart, ambitious, strong women who anchored one of America's most powerful news networks -- becoming headlines themselves when they risked everything to stand up to the man who made them famous.

programme.title: Fall River
programme.desc: The shocking story of a town caught in the frenzy of an alleged satanic cult practicing human sacrifice.

programme.title: Godfather of Harlem
programme.desc: Three Freedom Riders are murdered in Mississippi, and Bumpy Johnson wants justice, as well as a hedge against Federal investigation; Chin Gigante evades imprisonment with an "insanity" defense, and Malcolm X delivers his most fervent call to action.

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: A scientist (Bradford Dillman) experiments with mutated insects freed by an earthquake, making matters worse.

programme.title: Judy
programme.desc: Thirty years after starring in "The Wizard of Oz," beloved actress and singer Judy Garland arrives in London to perform sold-out shows at the Talk of the Town nightclub. While there, she reminisces with friends and fans and begins a whirlwind romance with musician Mickey Deans, her soon-to-be fifth husband.

programme.title: Marianne & Leonard: Words of Love
programme.desc: A story of enduring love between Leonard Cohen and his Norwegian muse, Marianne Ihlen. Filmmaker Nick Broomfield chronicles their relationship, from the early days in Greece to how their love evolved when Leonard became a successful musician.

programme.title: I Still See You
programme.desc: Ghosts inhabit what's left of the world after an apocalyptic event.

programme.title: The Age of Adaline
programme.desc: Adaline Bowman (Blake Lively) has miraculously remained a youthful 29 years of age for nearly eight decades, never allowing herself to get close to anyone lest they discover her secret. However, a chance encounter with a charismatic philanthropist named Ellis Jones (Michiel Huisman) reawakens Adaline's long-suppressed passion for life and romance. When a weekend with Ellis' parents threatens to expose the truth, Adaline makes a decision that changes her life forever.

programme.title: Bombshell
programme.desc: The provocative real story of three whip-smart, ambitious, strong women who anchored one of America's most powerful news networks -- becoming headlines themselves when they risked everything to stand up to the man who made them famous.

programme.title: Run the Race
programme.desc: All-star athlete Zach Truett finds glory on the high school football field -- working to earn a college scholarship and a ticket out of town. When a devastating knee injury forces Zach to the sidelines, his brother laces up his cleats to compete in track and field. Despite the setback, there seems to be one silver lining for Zach -- he soon develops a budding relationship with a young nurse who works at the hospital.

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: As a transplant from Boston, teenager Ren MacCormack (Kenny Wormald) gets a big dose of culture shock when he moves to a small Southern town called Bomont. A few years prior, a fatal accident involving five youths led local councilmen and a beloved clergyman (Dennis Quaid) to enact ordinances against loud music and dancing. Ren -- never one to toe the line -- challenges the ban, simultaneously revitalizing Bomont and falling in love with the clergyman's troubled daughter (Julianne Hough).

programme.title: Young Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A teenage Sherlock Holmes (Nicholas Rowe) meets and befriends his future sidekick, the bemused and bespectacled John Watson (Alan Cox). During their first semester of boarding school, a series of deaths occur on campus. Intrigued by the crime, Holmes looks into it and soon comes to suspect a poisonous hallucinogen. And then, in the midst of their investigation, Holmes and Watson stumble on a bizarre cult with a penchant for human sacrifice -- after which they must struggle to escape.

programme.title: Blue Chips
programme.desc: Pete Bell (Nick Nolte) is a college basketball coach who has to improve his team's standing -- by any means necessary. His hopes are pinned on a trio of talented players: Neon Boudeaux (Shaquille O'Neal), Butch McRae (Penny Hardaway) and Ricky Roe (Matt Nover). But in order to get them to sign to his school, Bell will have to illegally pay the players off. If he's caught, it could destroy Bell's coaching career and cast a cloud of shame over his team. Will he risk it all to win?

programme.title: The Program
programme.desc: A college football coach (James Caan) forfeits all but winning to get his troubled team to the big game.

programme.title: Jungleland
programme.desc: When a devastating loss in the ring leaves Lion and his manager/brother Stan in debt to a local crime boss, they are forced to risk it all in a bare-knuckle boxing tournament as the pair fight for a better life.

programme.title: Godfather of Harlem
programme.desc: An incident at the Geechee Club threatens to break up Bumpy and Chin's partnership; Adam Clayton Powell looks to end the filibuster on the Civil Rights Bill, even if it means playing dirty.

programme.title: Godfather of Harlem
programme.desc: Three Freedom Riders are murdered in Mississippi, and Bumpy Johnson wants justice, as well as a hedge against Federal investigation; Chin Gigante evades imprisonment with an "insanity" defense, and Malcolm X delivers his most fervent call to action.

programme.title: Fall River
programme.desc: The shocking story of a town caught in the frenzy of an alleged satanic cult practicing human sacrifice.

programme.title: Fall River
programme.desc: The shocking story of a town caught in the frenzy of an alleged satanic cult practicing human sacrifice.

programme.title: Star Trek V: The Final Frontier
programme.desc: A renegade Vulcan makes Kirk (William Shatner), Spock (Leonard Nimoy), McCoy (DeForest Kelley) and the Enterprise go to a planet at the center of the galaxy.

programme.title: General Commander
programme.desc: A CIA operative exacts revenge against the mob boss who killed a member of his team.

programme.title: Trauma Center
programme.desc: Alone and trapped in a locked-down hospital isolation ward overnight, an injured young woman must escape a pair of vicious killers who are after the only piece of evidence that can implicate them in a grisly murder: the bullet in her leg.

programme.title: Vault
programme.desc: Two small-time crooks cook up an ill-fated scheme to rob a nearby vault of $30 million--money that belongs to the Mafia.

programme.title: Jungleland
programme.desc: When a devastating loss in the ring leaves Lion and his manager/brother Stan in debt to a local crime boss, they are forced to risk it all in a bare-knuckle boxing tournament as the pair fight for a better life.

programme.title: Tyler Perry's A Madea Family Funeral
programme.desc: A joyous reunion in small-town Georgia turns into an unexpected nightmare when Madea, Joe, Aunt Bam and other family members gather for an anniversary party that turns out to be a sham. Instead of fun and relaxation, Madea and the gang soon find themselves attending an elaborate funeral that doesn't quite go according to plan.

programme.title: Vampire in Brooklyn
programme.desc: In the wake of her mother's death in a mental institution, detective Rita Veder (Angela Bassett) is assigned to a baffling serial murder case. After examining the crime scene -- a corpse-filled ship found adrift at sea -- Rita meets Maximilian (Eddie Murphy), a smooth-talking Caribbean playboy determined to romance her. When Rita begins suffering from crippling hallucinations, she calls upon Dr. Zeko (Zakes Mokae), an occultist who suspects a vampire is on the loose.

programme.title: Scrooged
programme.desc: In this modern take on Charles Dickens' "A Christmas Carol," Frank Cross (Bill Murray) is a wildly successful television executive whose cold ambition and curmudgeonly nature has driven away the love of his life, Claire Phillips (Karen Allen). But after firing a staff member, Eliot Loudermilk (Bobcat Goldthwait), on Christmas Eve, Frank is visited by a series of ghosts who give him a chance to re-evaluate his actions and right the wrongs of his past.

programme.title: The Wolf of Snow Hollow
programme.desc: A stressed-out police officer struggles not to give in to the paranoia that grips his small mountain town as bodies turn up after each full moon.

programme.title: Vanilla Sky
programme.desc: Tom Cruise and Cameron Crowe reunite after "Jerry Maguire" for "Vanilla Sky," the story of a young New York City publishing magnate who finds himself on an unexpected roller-coaster ride of romance, comedy, suspicion, love, sex and dreams in a mind-bending search for his soul.

programme.title: Godfather of Harlem
programme.desc: Three Freedom Riders are murdered in Mississippi, and Bumpy Johnson wants justice, as well as a hedge against Federal investigation; Chin Gigante evades imprisonment with an "insanity" defense, and Malcolm X delivers his most fervent call to action.

programme.desc: Lovable Englishman Charles (Hugh Grant) and his group of friends seem to be unlucky in love. When Charles meets a beautiful American named Carrie (Andie MacDowell) at a wedding, he thinks his luck may have changed. But, after one magical night, Carrie returns to the States, ending what might have been. As Charles and Carrie's paths continue to cross -- over a handful of nuptials and one funeral -- he comes to believe they are meant to be together, even if their timing always seems to be off.

programme.title: Some Kind of Wonderful
programme.desc: Keith Nelson (Eric Stoltz), an artsy high school outcast, tries to land a date with popular girl Amanda Jones (Lea Thompson) with some help from his tomboy best friend, Watts (Mary Stuart Masterson). However, his advances draw the ire of Amanda's snobby ex-boyfriend, Hardy Jenns (Craig Sheffer), who makes plans to get even. Matters are further complicated when Watts realizes she likes Keith as more than just a friend and tries to convince him to stop pursuing Amanda.

programme.title: Waiting to Exhale
programme.desc: Navigating through careers, family and romance, four friends bond over the shortcomings in their love lives -- namely, the scarcity of good men. Both as the "other woman," Savannah (Whitney Houston) and Robin (Lela Rochon) carry on relationships with married men, each believing their lovers will leave their wives for them. On the flip side, Bernadine (Angela Bassett) ends up alone when her husband divorces her for his mistress. Meanwhile, Gloria (Loretta Devine) finds love with a new neighbor.

programme.title: One Fine Day
programme.desc: Melanie Parker (Michelle Pfeiffer) is an architect who needs to give a very important presentation. Jack Taylor (George Clooney) is a reporter looking to land a big scoop for his story. Both are single parents whose children, Sammy (Alex D. Linz) and Maggie (Mae Whitman), respectively, miss the bus for a field trip. Left with their kids on such a hectic day, Parker and Taylor decide to put aside their bickering and juggle baby-sitting duties, but the rambunctious children don't make it easy.

programme.title: What to Expect When You're Expecting
programme.desc: Challenges of impending parenthood turn the lives of five couples upside down. Two celebrities are unprepared for the surprise demands of pregnancy; hormones wreak havoc on a baby-crazy author, while her husband tries not to be outdone by his father, who's expecting twins with his young trophy wife; a photographer's husband isn't sure about his wife's adoption plans; a one-time hook-up results in a surprise pregnancy for rival food-truck owners.

programme.title: Fall River
programme.desc: The shocking story of a town caught in the frenzy of an alleged satanic cult practicing human sacrifice.

programme.title: Fall River
programme.desc: The shocking story of a town caught in the frenzy of an alleged satanic cult practicing human sacrifice.

programme.title: Godfather of Harlem
programme.desc: An incident at the Geechee Club threatens to break up Bumpy and Chin's partnership; Adam Clayton Powell looks to end the filibuster on the Civil Rights Bill, even if it means playing dirty.

programme.title: Godfather of Harlem
programme.desc: Three Freedom Riders are murdered in Mississippi, and Bumpy Johnson wants justice, as well as a hedge against Federal investigation; Chin Gigante evades imprisonment with an "insanity" defense, and Malcolm X delivers his most fervent call to action.

programme.title: Elvis Goes There
programme.desc: Elvis Mitchell teams up with director Guillermo del Toro ("The Shape of Water") in Los Angeles, where they meet with actor Laurence Fishburne, director Ana Lily Amirpour and the unsung heroes who bring film creatures to life.

programme.title: Cyrano, My Love
programme.desc: In 1897 in Paris, a playwright offers a new and unwritten production to an investor.

programme.title: The Bookshop
programme.desc: Florence Green, a free-spirited widow, puts grief behind her and risks everything to open up a bookshop -- the first such shop in the sleepy seaside town of Hardborough, England. But this mini social revolution soon brings her fierce enemies: she invites the hostility of the town's less prosperous shopkeepers and also crosses Mrs. Gamart, Harborough's vengeful, embittered alpha female who is a wannabe doyenne of the local arts scene.

programme.title: Waiting to Exhale
programme.desc: Navigating through careers, family and romance, four friends bond over the shortcomings in their love lives -- namely, the scarcity of good men. Both as the "other woman," Savannah (Whitney Houston) and Robin (Lela Rochon) carry on relationships with married men, each believing their lovers will leave their wives for them. On the flip side, Bernadine (Angela Bassett) ends up alone when her husband divorces her for his mistress. Meanwhile, Gloria (Loretta Devine) finds love with a new neighbor.

programme.title: The Virgin Suicides
programme.desc: In an ordinary suburban house, on a lovely tree-lined street, in the middle of 1970s America, lived the five beautiful, dreamy Lisbon sisters, whose doomed fates indelibly marked the neighborhood boys who to this day continue to obsess over them. A story of love and repression, fantasy and terror, sex and death, memory and longing. It is at its core a mystery story: a heart-rending investigation into the impenetrable, life-altering secrets of American adolescence.

programme.title: Girl With a Pearl Earring
programme.desc: When her father goes blind, Griet (Scarlett Johansson) must go to work as a maid for painter Johannes Vermeer (Colin Firth). While cleaning the house, Griet strikes up an unlikely friendship with Vermeer, which both agree to keep secret for fear of provoking the painter's jealous wife, Catharina (Essie Davis). When wealthy patron Van Ruijven (Tom Wilkinson) begins to lust after Griet, and commissions a painting of her, Vermeer and Griet are obliged to spend long hours alone together.

programme.title: Judy
programme.desc: Thirty years after starring in "The Wizard of Oz," beloved actress and singer Judy Garland arrives in London to perform sold-out shows at the Talk of the Town nightclub. While there, she reminisces with friends and fans and begins a whirlwind romance with musician Mickey Deans, her soon-to-be fifth husband.

programme.title: Fall River
programme.desc: The shocking story of a town caught in the frenzy of an alleged satanic cult practicing human sacrifice.

programme.title: Godfather of Harlem
programme.desc: Three Freedom Riders are murdered in Mississippi, and Bumpy Johnson wants justice, as well as a hedge against Federal investigation; Chin Gigante evades imprisonment with an "insanity" defense, and Malcolm X delivers his most fervent call to action.

programme.title: The Age of Adaline
programme.desc: Adaline Bowman (Blake Lively) has miraculously remained a youthful 29 years of age for nearly eight decades, never allowing herself to get close to anyone lest they discover her secret. However, a chance encounter with a charismatic philanthropist named Ellis Jones (Michiel Huisman) reawakens Adaline's long-suppressed passion for life and romance. When a weekend with Ellis' parents threatens to expose the truth, Adaline makes a decision that changes her life forever.

programme.title: Regarding Henry
programme.desc: An unscrupulous corporate lawyer, Henry Turner (Harrison Ford) will do whatever it takes to win a case, and treats his family with the same degree of ruthlessness. After Henry gets caught in the middle of a robbery and is shot in the head, he wakes from a coma to find that he has amnesia and can't even remember how to do the simplest of tasks. As he recovers and relearns how to function, Henry reveals a much kinder and more thoughtful personality, much to the surprise of his family and friends.

programme.title: Bombshell
programme.desc: The provocative real story of three whip-smart, ambitious, strong women who anchored one of America's most powerful news networks -- becoming headlines themselves when they risked everything to stand up to the man who made them famous.

programme.title: Fall River
programme.desc: The shocking story of a town caught in the frenzy of an alleged satanic cult practicing human sacrifice.

programme.title: Godfather of Harlem
programme.desc: Three Freedom Riders are murdered in Mississippi, and Bumpy Johnson wants justice, as well as a hedge against Federal investigation; Chin Gigante evades imprisonment with an "insanity" defense, and Malcolm X delivers his most fervent call to action.

programme.title: Bug
programme.desc: A scientist (Bradford Dillman) experiments with mutated insects freed by an earthquake, making matters worse.

programme.title: Judy
programme.desc: Thirty years after starring in "The Wizard of Oz," beloved actress and singer Judy Garland arrives in London to perform sold-out shows at the Talk of the Town nightclub. While there, she reminisces with friends and fans and begins a whirlwind romance with musician Mickey Deans, her soon-to-be fifth husband.

programme.title: Marianne & Leonard: Words of Love
programme.desc: A story of enduring love between Leonard Cohen and his Norwegian muse, Marianne Ihlen. Filmmaker Nick Broomfield chronicles their relationship, from the early days in Greece to how their love evolved when Leonard became a successful musician.

programme.title: I Still See You
programme.desc: Ghosts inhabit what's left of the world after an apocalyptic event.

programme.title: The Age of Adaline
programme.desc: Adaline Bowman (Blake Lively) has miraculously remained a youthful 29 years of age for nearly eight decades, never allowing herself to get close to anyone lest they discover her secret. However, a chance encounter with a charismatic philanthropist named Ellis Jones (Michiel Huisman) reawakens Adaline's long-suppressed passion for life and romance. When a weekend with Ellis' parents threatens to expose the truth, Adaline makes a decision that changes her life forever.

programme.title: Bombshell
programme.desc: The provocative real story of three whip-smart, ambitious, strong women who anchored one of America's most powerful news networks -- becoming headlines themselves when they risked everything to stand up to the man who made them famous.

programme.title: Run the Race
programme.desc: All-star athlete Zach Truett finds glory on the high school football field -- working to earn a college scholarship and a ticket out of town. When a devastating knee injury forces Zach to the sidelines, his brother laces up his cleats to compete in track and field. Despite the setback, there seems to be one silver lining for Zach -- he soon develops a budding relationship with a young nurse who works at the hospital.

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: As a transplant from Boston, teenager Ren MacCormack (Kenny Wormald) gets a big dose of culture shock when he moves to a small Southern town called Bomont. A few years prior, a fatal accident involving five youths led local councilmen and a beloved clergyman (Dennis Quaid) to enact ordinances against loud music and dancing. Ren -- never one to toe the line -- challenges the ban, simultaneously revitalizing Bomont and falling in love with the clergyman's troubled daughter (Julianne Hough).

programme.title: Young Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A teenage Sherlock Holmes (Nicholas Rowe) meets and befriends his future sidekick, the bemused and bespectacled John Watson (Alan Cox). During their first semester of boarding school, a series of deaths occur on campus. Intrigued by the crime, Holmes looks into it and soon comes to suspect a poisonous hallucinogen. And then, in the midst of their investigation, Holmes and Watson stumble on a bizarre cult with a penchant for human sacrifice -- after which they must struggle to escape.

programme.title: Blue Chips
programme.desc: Pete Bell (Nick Nolte) is a college basketball coach who has to improve his team's standing -- by any means necessary. His hopes are pinned on a trio of talented players: Neon Boudeaux (Shaquille O'Neal), Butch McRae (Penny Hardaway) and Ricky Roe (Matt Nover). But in order to get them to sign to his school, Bell will have to illegally pay the players off. If he's caught, it could destroy Bell's coaching career and cast a cloud of shame over his team. Will he risk it all to win?

programme.title: The Program
programme.desc: A college football coach (James Caan) forfeits all but winning to get his troubled team to the big game.

programme.title: Jungleland
programme.desc: When a devastating loss in the ring leaves Lion and his manager/brother Stan in debt to a local crime boss, they are forced to risk it all in a bare-knuckle boxing tournament as the pair fight for a better life.

programme.title: Godfather of Harlem
programme.desc: An incident at the Geechee Club threatens to break up Bumpy and Chin's partnership; Adam Clayton Powell looks to end the filibuster on the Civil Rights Bill, even if it means playing dirty.

programme.title: Godfather of Harlem
programme.desc: Three Freedom Riders are murdered in Mississippi, and Bumpy Johnson wants justice, as well as a hedge against Federal investigation; Chin Gigante evades imprisonment with an "insanity" defense, and Malcolm X delivers his most fervent call to action.

programme.title: Fall River
programme.desc: The shocking story of a town caught in the frenzy of an alleged satanic cult practicing human sacrifice.

programme.title: Fall River
programme.desc: The shocking story of a town caught in the frenzy of an alleged satanic cult practicing human sacrifice.

programme.title: Star Trek V: The Final Frontier
programme.desc: A renegade Vulcan makes Kirk (William Shatner), Spock (Leonard Nimoy), McCoy (DeForest Kelley) and the Enterprise go to a planet at the center of the galaxy.

programme.title: General Commander
programme.desc: A CIA operative exacts revenge against the mob boss who killed a member of his team.

programme.title: Trauma Center
programme.desc: Alone and trapped in a locked-down hospital isolation ward overnight, an injured young woman must escape a pair of vicious killers who are after the only piece of evidence that can implicate them in a grisly murder: the bullet in her leg.

programme.title: Vault
programme.desc: Two small-time crooks cook up an ill-fated scheme to rob a nearby vault of $30 million--money that belongs to the Mafia.

programme.title: Jungleland
programme.desc: When a devastating loss in the ring leaves Lion and his manager/brother Stan in debt to a local crime boss, they are forced to risk it all in a bare-knuckle boxing tournament as the pair fight for a better life.

programme.title: Tyler Perry's A Madea Family Funeral
programme.desc: A joyous reunion in small-town Georgia turns into an unexpected nightmare when Madea, Joe, Aunt Bam and other family members gather for an anniversary party that turns out to be a sham. Instead of fun and relaxation, Madea and the gang soon find themselves attending an elaborate funeral that doesn't quite go according to plan.

programme.title: Vampire in Brooklyn
programme.desc: In the wake of her mother's death in a mental institution, detective Rita Veder (Angela Bassett) is assigned to a baffling serial murder case. After examining the crime scene -- a corpse-filled ship found adrift at sea -- Rita meets Maximilian (Eddie Murphy), a smooth-talking Caribbean playboy determined to romance her. When Rita begins suffering from crippling hallucinations, she calls upon Dr. Zeko (Zakes Mokae), an occultist who suspects a vampire is on the loose.

programme.title: Scrooged
programme.desc: In this modern take on Charles Dickens' "A Christmas Carol," Frank Cross (Bill Murray) is a wildly successful television executive whose cold ambition and curmudgeonly nature has driven away the love of his life, Claire Phillips (Karen Allen). But after firing a staff member, Eliot Loudermilk (Bobcat Goldthwait), on Christmas Eve, Frank is visited by a series of ghosts who give him a chance to re-evaluate his actions and right the wrongs of his past.

programme.title: Godfather of Harlem
programme.desc: Three Freedom Riders are murdered in Mississippi, and Bumpy Johnson wants justice, as well as a hedge against Federal investigation; Chin Gigante evades imprisonment with an "insanity" defense, and Malcolm X delivers his most fervent call to action.

programme.title: Fall River
programme.desc: The shocking story of a town caught in the frenzy of an alleged satanic cult practicing human sacrifice.

programme.title: War of the Worlds
programme.desc: Cracks start to show as the survivors find different ways to cope.

programme.title: War of the Worlds
programme.desc: The alien's connection to certain survivors raises difficult questions.

programme.title: Bound
programme.desc: Sparks fly when Violet (Jennifer Tilly) sets eyes on Corky (Gina Gershon) in an elevator. Violet is the girlfriend of a violent gangster, Caesar (Joe Pantoliano), while Corky is fresh out of prison and doing renovations on the apartment next door. As the two women launch into a passionate love affair, they assemble an intricate plan for Violet to escape from Caesar, with two million dollars of the mob's money -- but the important part is to make it out alive.

programme.title: Sliver
programme.desc: Well-to-do book editor Carly Norris (Sharon Stone) moves into a luxury apartment building before learning that a number of female tenants have been dying in grisly ways, allegedly at the hands of a serial killer. Soon, Norris becomes romantically involved with one of the prime suspects, building owner Zeke Hawkins (William Baldwin). The other suspect is her neighbor, writer Jack Landsford (Tom Berenger). Unsure of whom to trust, Norris must uncover the truth before she is the next victim.

programme.title: Midnight Heat
programme.desc: Banker John Gray (Brian Bosworth) is hit by a car, and he awakens days later having lost his memory. He goes through the motions of his plush Arizona lifestyle but keeps having momentary visions of a violent past and a sinister figure he identifies as Thomas Payne (Brad Dourif). After his wife, whom he barely knows, is killed, Gray travels to Los Angeles and explores the criminal underworld, hoping to discover the truth about his identity -- and to confront Payne.

programme.title: Sahara
programme.desc: Intent on winning a competition in place of her distinguished late father, beautiful young heiress Dale (Brooke Shields) takes on the guise of a man and competes in his spot, embarking on a car race that crosses the unforgiving Sahara desert. Although the villainous Rasoul (John Rhys-Davies) abducts Dale, the suave sheik Jaffar (Lambert Wilson) comes to her rescue. As Dale and Jaffar face more challenges and struggle to win the rally, they begin to fall for each other.

programme.title: Elvis Goes There
programme.desc: Elvis Mitchell meets filmmaker Paul Feig in London for a firsthand look at the evolution of his career in film, with the city's elegant style and traditions as a backdrop.

programme.title: The Last Man
programme.desc: A veteran who's suffering from post-traumatic stress disorder takes the advice of a street prophet and starts preparing for the end of days.

programme.title: The Little Hours
programme.desc: Medieval nuns Alessandra, Fernanda, and Ginevra lead a simple life in their convent. Their days are spent chafing at monastic routine, spying on one another, and berating the estate's day laborer. After a particularly vicious insult session drives the peasant away, Father Tommasso brings on newly hired hand Massetto, a virile young servant forced into hiding by his angry lord. Introduced to the sisters as a deaf-mute to discourage temptation, Massetto struggles to maintain his cover.

programme.title: The Haunting in Connecticut
programme.desc: When their son Matt (Kyle Gallner) receives a diagnosis of cancer, Sara (Virginia Madsen) and Peter (Martin Donovan) Campbell move to Connecticut to be closer to his doctors. At first all is well, but then Matt becomes increasingly disturbed by what appears to be paranormal activity. Sara turns to a priest for help, and the ghosts are seemingly banished -- but Matt's condition takes a sudden and unexplained turn for the worse, and the lives of Sara and the rest of her family are endangered.

programme.title: New in Town
programme.desc: Lucy Hill (Renée Zellweger), an ambitious executive, lives the high life in Miami. She loves climbing the corporate ladder as well as all the material goods that her success can buy. When she is offered a temporary assignment to restructure a factory in a backwater town, she eagerly accepts and anticipates a huge promotion in the pipeline. However, what Lucy gets is a life-changing experience and romance with the man of her dreams (Harry Connick Jr.).

programme.title: Florence Foster Jenkins
programme.desc: In the 1940s, New York socialite Florence Foster Jenkins (Meryl Streep) dreams of becoming a great opera singer. Unfortunately, her ambition far exceeds her talent. The voice Florence hears in her head is beautiful, but to everyone else it is quite lousy. Her husband St. Clair goes to extreme lengths to make sure his wife never finds out how awful she truly is. When Florence announces her plans for a concert at Carnegie Hall, St. Clair soon realizes that he's facing his greatest challenge yet.

programme.title: Four Weddings and a Funeral
programme.desc: Lovable Englishman Charles (Hugh Grant) and his group of friends seem to be unlucky in love. When Charles meets a beautiful American named Carrie (Andie MacDowell) at a wedding, he thinks his luck may have changed. But, after one magical night, Carrie returns to the States, ending what might have been. As Charles and Carrie's paths continue to cross -- over a handful of nuptials and one funeral -- he comes to believe they are meant to be together, even if their timing always seems to be off.

programme.title: Some Kind of Wonderful
programme.desc: Keith Nelson (Eric Stoltz), an artsy high school outcast, tries to land a date with popular girl Amanda Jones (Lea Thompson) with some help from his tomboy best friend, Watts (Mary Stuart Masterson). However, his advances draw the ire of Amanda's snobby ex-boyfriend, Hardy Jenns (Craig Sheffer), who makes plans to get even. Matters are further complicated when Watts realizes she likes Keith as more than just a friend and tries to convince him to stop pursuing Amanda.

And then, in the midst of their investigation, Holmes and Watson stumble on a bizarre cult with a penchant for human sacrifice -- after which they must struggle to escape.

programme.title: Blue Chips
programme.desc: Pete Bell (Nick Nolte) is a college basketball coach who has to improve his team's standing -- by any means necessary. His hopes are pinned on a trio of talented players: Neon Boudeaux (Shaquille O'Neal), Butch McRae (Penny Hardaway) and Ricky Roe (Matt Nover). But in order to get them to sign to his school, Bell will have to illegally pay the players off. If he's caught, it could destroy Bell's coaching career and cast a cloud of shame over his team. Will he risk it all to win?

programme.title: The Program
programme.desc: A college football coach (James Caan) forfeits all but winning to get his troubled team to the big game.

programme.title: Jungleland
programme.desc: When a devastating loss in the ring leaves Lion and his manager/brother Stan in debt to a local crime boss, they are forced to risk it all in a bare-knuckle boxing tournament as the pair fight for a better life.

programme.title: Godfather of Harlem
programme.desc: An incident at the Geechee Club threatens to break up Bumpy and Chin's partnership; Adam Clayton Powell looks to end the filibuster on the Civil Rights Bill, even if it means playing dirty.

programme.title: Godfather of Harlem
programme.desc: Three Freedom Riders are murdered in Mississippi, and Bumpy Johnson wants justice, as well as a hedge against Federal investigation; Chin Gigante evades imprisonment with an "insanity" defense, and Malcolm X delivers his most fervent call to action.

programme.title: Fall River
programme.desc: The shocking story of a town caught in the frenzy of an alleged satanic cult practicing human sacrifice.

programme.title: Fall River
programme.desc: The shocking story of a town caught in the frenzy of an alleged satanic cult practicing human sacrifice.

programme.title: Star Trek V: The Final Frontier
programme.desc: A renegade Vulcan makes Kirk (William Shatner), Spock (Leonard Nimoy), McCoy (DeForest Kelley) and the Enterprise go to a planet at the center of the galaxy.

programme.title: General Commander
programme.desc: A CIA operative exacts revenge against the mob boss who killed a member of his team.

programme.title: Trauma Center
programme.desc: Alone and trapped in a locked-down hospital isolation ward overnight, an injured young woman must escape a pair of vicious killers who are after the only piece of evidence that can implicate them in a grisly murder: the bullet in her leg.

programme.title: Vault
programme.desc: Two small-time crooks cook up an ill-fated scheme to rob a nearby vault of $30 million--money that belongs to the Mafia.

programme.title: Jungleland
programme.desc: When a devastating loss in the ring leaves Lion and his manager/brother Stan in debt to a local crime boss, they are forced to risk it all in a bare-knuckle boxing tournament as the pair fight for a better life.

programme.title: Tyler Perry's A Madea Family Funeral
programme.desc: A joyous reunion in small-town Georgia turns into an unexpected nightmare when Madea, Joe, Aunt Bam and other family members gather for an anniversary party that turns out to be a sham. Instead of fun and relaxation, Madea and the gang soon find themselves attending an elaborate funeral that doesn't quite go according to plan.

programme.title: Vampire in Brooklyn
programme.desc: In the wake of her mother's death in a mental institution, detective Rita Veder (Angela Bassett) is assigned to a baffling serial murder case. After examining the crime scene -- a corpse-filled ship found adrift at sea -- Rita meets Maximilian (Eddie Murphy), a smooth-talking Caribbean playboy determined to romance her. When Rita begins suffering from crippling hallucinations, she calls upon Dr. Zeko (Zakes Mokae), an occultist who suspects a vampire is on the loose.

programme.title: Scrooged
programme.desc: In this modern take on Charles Dickens' "A Christmas Carol," Frank Cross (Bill Murray) is a wildly successful television executive whose cold ambition and curmudgeonly nature has driven away the love of his life, Claire Phillips (Karen Allen). But after firing a staff member, Eliot Loudermilk (Bobcat Goldthwait), on Christmas Eve, Frank is visited by a series of ghosts who give him a chance to re-evaluate his actions and right the wrongs of his past.

programme.title: The Wolf of Snow Hollow
programme.desc: A stressed-out police officer struggles not to give in to the paranoia that grips his small mountain town as bodies turn up after each full moon.

programme.title: The Spy Next Door
programme.desc: Bob Ho (Jackie Chan), an undercover operative for the CIA, decides to give up his career and marry his girlfriend, Gillian (Amber Valletta). First however, he has one more mission to complete: Gain the approval of Gillian's children. Bob volunteers to baby-sit when Gillian is called away, but the operation hits a snag when one of the kids mistakenly downloads a top-secret formula, and a Russian terrorist takes aim at Bob's prospective family.

programme.title: Footloose
programme.desc: Moving in from Chicago, newcomer Ren McCormack (Kevin Bacon) is in shock when he discovers the small Midwestern town he now calls home has made dancing and rock music illegal. As he struggles to fit in, Ren faces an uphill battle to change things. With the help of his new friend, Willard Hewitt (Christopher Penn), and defiant teen Ariel Moore (Lori Singer), he might loosen up this conservative town. But Ariel's influential father, Reverend Shaw Moore (John Lithgow), stands in the way.

programme.title: Downhill Racer
programme.desc: A smug and overly self-assured downhill skier, David Chappellet (Robert Redford), joins the American ski team and quickly makes waves with his arrogant behavior and even flashier maneuvers on the slopes, falling into conflict with the team's coach (Gene Hackman). A rivalry also develops between David and Johnny Creech (Jim McMullan), the man who considered the team's best skier, as both push themselves and each other in a race to the Olympic Games.

programme.title: Young Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A teenage Sherlock Holmes (Nicholas Rowe) meets and befriends his future sidekick, the bemused and bespectacled John Watson (Alan Cox). During their first semester of boarding school, a series of deaths occur on campus. Intrigued by the crime, Holmes looks into it and soon comes to suspect a poisonous hallucinogen. And then, in the midst of their investigation, Holmes and Watson stumble on a bizarre cult with a penchant for human sacrifice -- after which they must struggle to escape.

programme.title: A Night at the Roxbury
programme.desc: Despite being well into adulthood, brothers Doug (Chris Kattan) and Steve Butabi (Will Ferrell) still live at home and work in the flower shop owned by their dad (Dan Hedaya). They exist only to hit on women at discos, though they're routinely unsuccessful until a chance run-in with Richard Grieco (Richard Grieco) gets them inside the swank Roxbury club. Mistaken for high rollers, they meet their dream women, Vivica (Gigi Rice) and Cambi (Elisa Donovan), and resolve to open a club of their own.

programme.title: Lady in a Cage
programme.desc: An injured woman is trapped in her private elevator during a power failure, while her home is ransacked.

programme.title: The Hangman
programme.desc: Townsfolk and a sheriff (Fess Parker) protect a wanted man from a deputy marshal (Robert Taylor) who tracks him down.

programme.title: Rustlers' Rhapsody
programme.desc: A singing cowboy (Tom Berenger) roams the Wild West with his sidekick (G.W. Bailey), dancing horse and fancy wardrobe.

programme.title: Young Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: A teenage Sherlock Holmes (Nicholas Rowe) meets and befriends his future sidekick, the bemused and bespectacled John Watson (Alan Cox). During their first semester of boarding school, a series of deaths occur on campus. Intrigued by the crime, Holmes looks into it and soon comes to suspect a poisonous hallucinogen. And then, in the midst of their investigation, Holmes and Watson stumble on a bizarre cult with a penchant for human sacrifice -- after which they must struggle to escape.

programme.desc: Bob Ho (Jackie Chan), an undercover operative for the CIA, decides to give up his career and marry his girlfriend, Gillian (Amber Valletta). First however, he has one more mission to complete: Gain the approval of Gillian's children. Bob volunteers to baby-sit when Gillian is called away, but the operation hits a snag when one of the kids mistakenly downloads a top-secret formula, and a Russian terrorist takes aim at Bob's prospective family.
